metadata.title: CVE-2018-5187 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 60 and Firefox ESR 60. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60, Firefox ESR < 60.1, and Firefox < 61.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-5187` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 61.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 61.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 61.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

advisory.discovered_by: Christian Holler, Sebastian Hengst, Nils Ohlmeier, Jon Coppeard, Randell Jesup, Ted Campbell, Gary Kwong, and Jean-Yves Avenard

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '61.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
